Types#

class Vector3#

Alias of tuple[float, float, float] as (x, y, z) in mm.

class Quaternion#

Alias of tuple[float, float, float, float] as (x, y, z, w)

class Matrix12x12#

Alias of tuple of tuples of floats (with shape 12 x 12)

class Matrix3x4#

Alias of tuple of tuples of floats (with shape 3 x 4)

MoCap Description#

class natnet_py.protocol.MoCapDescription#

Data Descriptions class

cameras: list[CameraDescription]#
devices: list[DeviceDescription]#
force_plates: list[ForcePlateDescription]#
marker_sets: list[MarkerSetDescription]#
rigid_bodies: list[RigidBodyDescription]#
skeletons: list[SkeletonDescription]#
class natnet_py.protocol.CameraDescription#

A MoCap Camera

name: str#

name

orientation: tuple[float, float, float, float]#

orientation

position: tuple[float, float, float]#

position

class natnet_py.protocol.DeviceDescription#

An external device

channel_data_type: int#

channel data type code

channels: list[str]#

channel names

device_type: int#

device ‘type’ code

id: int#

used for order, and for identification in the data stream

name: str#

device name as appears in Motive

serial_number: str#

for unique device identification

class natnet_py.protocol.ForcePlateDescription#

A force plate

cal_matrix: tuple[tuple[float, float, float, float, float, float, float, float, float, float, float, float], tuple[float, float, float, float, float, float, float, float, float, float, float, float], tuple[float, float, float, float, float, float, float, float, float, float, float, float], tuple[float, float, float, float, float, float, float, float, float, float, float, float], tuple[float, float, float, float, float, float, float, float, float, float, float, float], tuple[float, float, float, float, float, float, float, float, float, float, float, float], tuple[float, float, float, float, float, float, float, float, float, float, float, float], tuple[float, float, float, float, float, float, float, float, float, float, float, float], tuple[float, float, float, float, float, float, float, float, float, float, float, float], tuple[float, float, float, float, float, float, float, float, float, float, float, float], tuple[float, float, float, float, float, float, float, float, float, float, float, float], tuple[float, float, float, float, float, float, float, float, float, float, float, float]] | None = None#

force plate calibration matrix (for raw analog voltage channel type only)

channel_data_type: int = 0#

0=Calibrated force data, 1=Raw analog voltages

channels: list[str]#

channel names

corners: tuple[tuple[float, float, float], tuple[float, float, float], tuple[float, float, float], tuple[float, float, float]] | None = None#

plate corners, in world (aka Mocap System) coordinates, clockwise from plate +x,+y (refer to C3D spec for details)

id: int = 0#

used for order, and for identification in the data stream

length: float = 0#

plate physical length (manufacturer supplied)

plate_type: int = 0#

force plate ‘type’ (refer to C3D spec for details)

position: tuple[float, float, float] = (0, 0, 0)#

electrical center offset (from electrical center to geometric center-top of force plate) (manufacturer supplied)

serial_number: str = ''#

for unique plate identification

width: float = 0#

plate physical width (manufacturer supplied)

class natnet_py.protocol.MarkerSetDescription#

A set of markers

markers: list[str]#

marker names

name: str = 'Not Set'#

name

class natnet_py.protocol.RigidBodyDescription#

A rigid body

id: int = 0#

RigidBody identifier

Streaming ID value for rigid body assets, and Bone index value for skeleton rigid bodies.

markers: list[RBMarker]#

markers

name: str = ''#

name

parent_id: int = 0#

ID of parent Rigid Body (in case hierarchy exists; otherwise -1)

position: tuple[float, float, float] = (0, 0, 0)#

offset position relative to parent

class natnet_py.protocol.SkeletonDescription#

A Skeleton

id: int = 0#

unique identifier

name: str = ''#

name

rigid_bodies: list[RigidBodyDescription]#

rigid bodies (bones) descriptions

class natnet_py.protocol.RBMarker#

A marker that is part of a rigid body

active_label: int = 0#

active label (0 if not specified)

name: str = ''#

name

position: tuple[float, float, float] = (0, 0, 0)#

marker location

MoCap Data#

class natnet_py.protocol.MoCapData#

Data gathered during one Optitrack update

devices: list[DeviceData]#

devices

force_plates: list[ForcePlateData]#

force plates

frame_number: int = -1#

host defined frame number

labeled_markers: list[LabeledMarkerData]#

labeled markers

marker_sets: list[MarkerSetData]#

marker sets

rigid_bodies: list[RigidBodyData]#

rigid bodies

skeletons: list[SkeletonData]#

skeletons

suffix_data: FrameSuffixData | None = None#

frame metadata (timing, state, …)

unlabeled_markers_positions: list[tuple[float, float, float]]#

unlabeled markers

class natnet_py.protocol.MarkerSetData#

The state of a set of markers

name: str = ''#

name

positions: list[tuple[float, float, float]]#

positions

class natnet_py.protocol.MarkersData#

The state of sets of markers

marker_sets: list[MarkerSetData]#

marker sets

unlabeled_markers_positions: list[tuple[float, float, float]]#

unlabeled markers

class natnet_py.protocol.LabeledMarkerData#

State of a labeled marker

property decoded_marker_id: tuple[int, int]#
property decoded_param: tuple[bool, bool, bool]#
id: int#

Unique identifier

For active markers, this is the Active ID. For passive markers, this is the PointCloud assigned ID. For legacy assets that are created prior to 2.0, this is both AssetID (High-bit) and Member ID (Lo-bit)

param: int = 0#

bitmask of host defined parameters. Bit values:

  • 0: Occluded

  • 1: PointCloudSolved

  • 2: ModelFilled

  • 3: HasModel

  • 4: Unlabeled

  • 5: Active

  • 6: Established

  • 7: Measurement

position: tuple[float, float, float]#

marker position

residual: float = 0.0#

marker error residual, in m/ray

size: float = 0.0#

marker size

class natnet_py.protocol.RigidBodyData#

The state of a rigid body.

error: float = 0.0#

Mean measure-to-solve deviation (mean marker error) (meters)

id: int#

RigidBody identifier

For rigid body assets, this is the Streaming ID value. For skeleton assets, this combines both skeleton ID (High-bit) and Bone ID (Low-bit).

markers: list[RigidBodyMarkerData]#

markers

orientation: tuple[float, float, float, float]#

orientation

position: tuple[float, float, float]#

position

tracking_valid: bool = False#

whether the rigid body is currently tracked

class natnet_py.protocol.SkeletonData#

Skeleton data (requires Motive Body)

id: int = 0#

Skeleton unique identifier

rigid_bodies: list[RigidBodyData]#

Rigid bodies composing the skeleton

class natnet_py.protocol.AnalogChannelData#

Data read from an analog channel

values: list[float]#

Signal readings

class natnet_py.protocol.ForcePlateData#

Data read by a force plate

channels: list[AnalogChannelData]#

Channels (signal) (e.g. Fx[], Fy[], Fz[])

id: int = 0#

ForcePlate ID

class natnet_py.protocol.DeviceData#

Data read by external device

channels: list[AnalogChannelData]#

Channels data (e.g. ai0, ai1, ai2)

id: int = 0#

Device ID

class natnet_py.protocol.FrameSuffixData#

Metadata of an Optitrack update

bitstream_version_changed: bool = False#

whether the bitstream version has changed

is_editing: bool = False#

whether it is in editing mode (vs live mode)

is_recording: bool = False#

whether is recording

stamp_camera_mid_exposure: int = -1#

Given in host’s high resolution ticks (from e.g. QueryPerformanceCounter)

stamp_data_received: int = -1#

Given in host’s high resolution ticks (from e.g. QueryPerformanceCounter)

stamp_transmit: int = -1#

Given in host’s high resolution ticks (from e.g. QueryPerformanceCounter)

timecode: int = -1#

SMPTE timecode (if available)

timecode_sub: int = -1#

timecode sub-frame data

timestamp: float = -1#

timestamp since software start ( software timestamp )

tracked_models_changed: bool = False#

whether the model list changed
